taxon_identification.other_info_on_name: [Greek echinos, hedgehog, and masto, breast, referring to the spiny tubercles]

bio:treatment.discussion: Two phylogenetic studies of chloroplast DNA sequenced (J. M. Porter et al. 2000; R. Nyffeler 2002) support the conclusion that Echinomastus is the genus most closely related to Sclerocactus. Athough morphologically cohesive, Echinomastus is inferred to be a paraphyletic group, with some species (i.e., E. johnsonii) more closely related to Sclerocactus than to other members of Echinomastus. Further studies will be required to determine whether those genera should be combined under a broader circumscription of Sclerocatus.
Without explanation, L. D. Benson (1982) erroneously extended the name Neolloydia to this group of cacti, which is not closely related to Neolloydia.
